body_html:
@eaplatanios @drpngx Sorry to comment on this closed issue, but I have a similar problem as code shown below:

with tf.Session() as sess:
    for i in range(0, 1000):
        fread = tf.read_file('./data.text')
        sess.run(fread)

In the loop, memory consumption will increase time by time.

My question is how to free this tf.Tensor(fread) explicit?
Could you take a look please, Thanks!

body:
@eaplatanios @drpngx Sorry to comment on this closed issue, but I have a similar problem as code shown below:

```python
with tf.Session() as sess:
    for i in range(0, 1000):
        fread = tf.read_file('./data.text')
        sess.run(fread)
```

In the loop, memory consumption will increase time by time.

My question is how to free this `tf.Tensor`(fread) explicit?
Could you take a look please, Thanks!
